FuncDef:
The l2tp calling-station-id vlan-0-invalid command sets the invalid VLAN ID to 0 in the calling station ID that the L2TP user (LAC) sends to the LNS.
The undo l2tp calling-station-id command restores the default invalid VLAN ID, 4096.
By default, the invalid VLAN ID is 4096.
ExtraInfo: Some LNSs use 0 as the default invalid VLAN ID and some LNSs use 4096 as the default invalid VLAN ID. Use this command according to the default invalid VLAN ID on the peer LNS.
